title: Remote Peninsula
text:
The Remote Peninsula is a <a href="peninsula">peninsula</a> located on the eastern coast of <a href="Baffin%20Island">Baffin Island</a>. It is part of the <a href="Qikiqtaaluk%20Region">Qikiqtaaluk Region</a> of the <a href="Canada">Canadian</a> territory of <a href="Nunavut">Nunavut</a>. The <a href="Inuit">Inuit</a> settlement of <a href="Pond%20Inlet">Pond Inlet</a> is to the northwest and <a href="Clyde%20River%2C%20Nunavut">Clyde River</a> is to the southeast.
Geography.
The Remote Peninsula extends northwards into the <a href="Baffin%20Bay">Baffin Bay</a> from the island's mainland. It is bounded by <a href="Gibbs%20Fiord">Gibbs Fiord</a> and the <a href="Stewart%20Valley%2C%20Nunavut">Stewart Valley</a> in the east, the <a href="Baffin%20Bay">Baffin Bay</a> in the north, <a href="Sam%20Ford%20Fiord">Sam Ford Fiord</a> in the east, and in the south by <a href="Walker%20Arm">Walker Arm</a>, the latter fjord's offshoot. The peninsula is attached to the mainland by a narrow <a href="isthmus">isthmus</a> in the southwest.
The Remote Peninsula is approximately long and has a maximum width of . It is <a href="mountainous">mountainous</a> and has many active <a href="glaciers">glaciers</a>. Its highest point is <a href="Ukpik%20Peak">Ukpik Peak</a>, a high <a href="topographic%20prominence">prominent</a> summit. Other noteworthy mountains include the formidable-looking <a href="Sail%20Peaks">Sail Peaks</a> facing Stewart Valley, and also <a href="Tiiturvik%20Peak">Tiiturvik Peak</a>, <a href="Nauttiaq%20Peak">Nauttiaq Peak</a>, <a href="Qablunaaq%20Peak">Qablunaaq Peak</a>, <a href="Aglu%20Peak">Aglu Peak</a>, <a href="Mount%20Longstaff">Mount Longstaff</a>, <a href="Nallaqtaq%20Peak">Nallaqtaq Peak</a> and <a href="Atqut%20Ridge">Atqut Ridge</a> —all located in the southern and SW area of the peninsula, as well as <a href="Hangover%20Hill">Hangover Hill</a> in the east.
The <a href="Remote%20Lake">Remote Lake</a> is an isolated 10 m deep lake in the northeast of the peninsula where a phenomenon of unnatural warming has been detected. Other noteworthy geographic features of the peninsula include <a href="Cape%20Come%20Again">Cape Come Again</a> (Qaqulluit Nuvua) —its northernmost headland, and <a href="Refuge%20Harbour">Refuge Harbour</a> in the west.
